About Me

Hi! I'm Chris Dearnley, a developer passionate about building efficient, scalable systems and sharing knowledge through code and writing.

What I Do

I work primarily in the intersection of development and operations, helping teams build better software deployment pipelines, infrastructure automation, and development workflows.

Areas of Focus

  • DevOps & Infrastructure - Container orchestration, CI/CD, cloud architecture
  • Web Development - Full-stack JavaScript/TypeScript, modern frameworks
  • Automation - Scripting, workflow optimization, developer tooling
  • Photography - Capturing moments and sharing visual stories

About This Blog

This blog is built with Astro and Decap CMS, hosted on Cloudflare Pages. It's designed to be fast, simple, and focused on content.

You'll find a mix of technical articles, code snippets, DevOps tips, and occasional photography. Everything is written to be practical and immediately useful.

Get in Touch

The best way to reach me is through the comments on any post (powered by giscus and GitHub Discussions) or by opening an issue on the blog's repository.

Thanks for reading, and I hope you find something useful here!

DevBlog

A modern blog about development, DevOps, and the craft of building software.
